ovdesc.p: EB.MORTGAGE.FORM1, stores all the details pertaining to an applicant, who has applied for a loan. It is a repository of all application forms. Each application form is identified by an unique application form id (@ID of the table EB.MORTGAGE.FORM1). The @ID is auto generated. All the details of an application form can be retireved by providing the application form id in the table EB.MORTGAGE.FORM1. Details like applicant's personal details, employment details, internal and external scores, status of the application, decisions and remarks of the approving authorities, etc can be retrieved from the this table. Applications for 3 types of loans are defined, Mortgage loan, Personal loan and Auto Loan.

desc.p: Specifies the current occupation of the applicant.
1-35 type A (alphanumeric) characters.
This field can contain the phone numbers of the applicant's current employment.
Maximum of 17 characters allowed

The unique reference number for the non-contract specific documents tracked for customers.
Format of the ID is Customer ID.* Document Type ID, where the first part refers to the ID of a valid CUSTOMER record, and second part refers to the ID of a valid DOCUMENT.TYPE record.
Value of the second part of ID (DOCUMENT.TYPE) would be used by T24 in calculation of Expiry Date (Field: END.DATE) of a Document with valid status.
The ID identification number for the type of ID selected to be specified here. For eg: Passport number.
Defines the date up to which the document type would be effective for tracking purposes.
Input optional.
Date entered should be greater than or equal to BEGIN. DATE.
Date entered should be greater than or equal to Bank Date.
Standard T24 date format.
The overall, original or nominal value of the collateral.
One of five value fields attached to the collateral.
This value is for information purposes only and is not involved in any of the collateral processing which takes place in the system (i.e. revaluation, reallocation).

TDS stands for Total Debt Servicing ratio. A debt service measure that financial lenders use as a rule of thumb to give a preliminary assessment about whether a potential borrower is already in too much debt. The formula for the ratio is (Summation("Liab.amt"*Mid reval rate of "liab.ccy" * 12 /"Fqy.in.months"))*100 divided by ("Income.total"*12). This ratio is very similar to the gross debt service ratio (GDS) except that the GDS does not account for non-housing related payments. TDS allows for a slightly more detailed view of a potential borrower's financial situation.
Start date of customer’s commencement of liability.

Unique identification number for the arrangement contract. The format of the ID is as follows
AAYYDDDXXXXX
where: AA - Arrangement Architecture module identifier, YYDDD - Year and date of input in julian date format, XXXXX - is a random string generated by the system.
If an arrangement is linked to ACCOUNT, then the account number and the arrangement id can be used inter-changeably.
The internal ID of the collateral held by the customer, picked from the table COLLATERAL. This is the unique identifier of COLLATERAL.

Format of the ID is Customer ID.* Document Type ID, where the first part refers to the ID of a valid CUSTOMER record, and second part refers to the ID of a valid DOCUMENT.TYPE record.
Value of the second part of ID (DOCUMENT.TYPE) would be used by T24 in calculation of Expiry Date (Field: END.DATE) of a Document with valid status.

GDS stands for Gross Debt Servicing ratio. A debt service measure that financial lenders use as a rule of thumb to give a preliminary assessment about whether a potential borrower is already in too much debt. The formula for the ratio is (Summation("Liab.amt"*Mid reval rate of "liab.ccy" * 12 /"Fqy.in.months"))*100 divided by ("Income.total"*12). The formula is similar to that of TDS calculation, however the difference between the TDS and GDS is that TDS includes other liabilities as well, while GDS includes only mortgage related liabilities.
Specifies the date on which the Sale Agreement got executed.
Standard date format (YYYYMMDD).

Validation rules:
Up to 9 date characters (standard Date format) - Type D
The type of ID provided by the Joint applicant. A dropdown field with the oiptions as Driving License, Passport etc. Multivalue field.
Specifies the DAO of the user who has entered the document details in the system. Any valid ID from the DEPT.ACCT.OFFICER table. No input field.
Specifies the method of payment. Options are Capitalise and Due.
Specifies the maximum permissible term for the loan. Loan term cannot be more than the maximum term specified. Validation rules:Max 5 digits allowed
ID of the DOCUMENT.TYPE. The type of document is defined in the table DOCUMENT.TYPE. A drop down field displaying all the IDs of the table DOCUMENT.TYPE
Stores the address of the applicant.
1-35 type A (alphanumeric) characters.
Indicates the option to print the Inprinciple approval document.
Allowed values are Print and Null.
Indicates whether the Inprinciple approval document was received or not.
Allowed values are Yes and Null.
Specifies the type of approval to be processed for an application in case of mortgage loans.
Allowed values are Inprinciple Approval and Full Approval.
